parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "scheduler": "Slurm",
    "scheduler_module": "slurm/tscc/current",
    "spack_version": "0.17.3",
    "spack_instance_name": "cpu",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/cpu",
    "intel_license_file": "40000@elprado.sdsc.edu:40200@elprado.sdsc.edu",
    "spack_package": "ior@3.3.0",
    "spack_compiler": "intel@19.1.1.217",
    "spack_variants": "+hdf5 +ncmpi",
    "spack_dependencies": "^openmpi@4.1.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openmpi@4.1.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER}) ^hdf5@1.10.7/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' hdf5@1.10.7 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} +mpi ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^parallel-netcdf@1.12.2/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' parallel-netcdf@1.12.2 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@4.1.3)",
    "spack_spec": "ior@3.3.0 % intel@19.1.1.217 +hdf5 +ncmpi ^openmpi@4.1.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openmpi@4.1.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER}) ^hdf5@1.10.7/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' hdf5@1.10.7 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} +mpi ^openmpi@4.1.3) ^parallel-netcdf@1.12.2/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' parallel-netcdf@1.12.2 % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ^openmpi@4.1.3)",
    "resource_requirements": {
      "nodes": 1,
      "tasks_per_node": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 8,
      "time": "00:30:00"
    },
    "dependent_script": "netcdf-c@4.8.1.sh"
  }
}
```

The script uses **Spack** as its application to manage scientific software. The script runs on a Slurm cluster and utilizes Spack to install and configure the ior package with specific dependencies. It uses the intel compiler and includes several dependencies, such as openmpi, hdf5, and parallel-netcdf. The script also utilizes Slurm for job scheduling and dependency management. The script specifies resource requirements like the number of nodes, tasks per node, and CPUs per task, along with a time limit. It also runs a dependent script 'netcdf-c@4.8.1.sh' after the installation of ior using a Slurm dependency.
